title: 988 Suicide & Crisis Lifeline
description: Call or text 988 anytime in the US. Provides 24/7, free and confidential support for people in distress, prevention and crisis resources for you or your loved ones.
citation: Vibrant Emotional Health. (n.d.). *988 Suicide & Crisis Lifeline*. Retrieved from https://988lifeline.org/

title: Crisis Text Line
description: Text HOME to 741741 from anywhere in the US, anytime, about any type of crisis. A live, trained Crisis Counselor responds quickly from a secure online platform.
citation: Crisis Text Line. (n.d.). *Crisis Text Line*. Retrieved from https://www.crisistextline.org/

title: The Trevor Project
description: The leading national organization providing crisis intervention and suicide prevention services to lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer & questioning (LGBTQ) young people under 25.
citation: The Trevor Project. (n.d.). *Get help*. Retrieved from https://www.thetrevorproject.org/get-help/

title: National Domestic Violence Hotline
description: 24/7 free, confidential support for survivors of domestic violence. Call 1-800-799-7233 or text 'START' to 88788.
citation: National Domestic Violence Hotline. (n.d.). *National Domestic Violence Hotline*. Retrieved from https://www.thehotline.org/

title: Psychology Today Therapist Directory
description: A comprehensive directory of therapists, psychiatrists, and treatment centers, searchable by location, insurance, and specialty.
citation: Psychology Today. (n.d.). *Find a therapist*. Retrieved from https://www.psychologytoday.com/us/therapists

title: National Alliance on Mental Illness (NAMI)
description: The nation's largest grassroots mental health organization dedicated to building better lives for the millions of Americans affected by mental illness.
citation: National Alliance on Mental Illness. (n.d.). *Home*. Retrieved from https://www.nami.org/Home

title: SAMHSA National Helpline
description: A free, confidential, 24/7, 365-day-a-year treatment referral and information service for individuals and families facing mental and/or substance use disorders.
citation: Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration. (n.d.). *National Helpline*. Retrieved from https://www.samhsa.gov/find-help/national-helpline

title: Self-Injury Outreach and Support (SiOS)
description: A non-profit outreach initiative providing current information and helpful resources about self-injury for individuals and their families.
citation: Self-Injury Outreach and Support. (n.d.). *Self-Injury Outreach and Support*. Retrieved from http://sioutreach.org/

title: National Eating Disorders Association (NEDA)
description: The leading non-profit organization supporting individuals and families affected by eating disorders through resources, support, and advocacy.
citation: National Eating Disorders Association. (n.d.). *National Eating Disorders Association*. Retrieved from https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/

title: DBT Self-Help
description: An online resource for learning the skills of Dialectical Behavior Therapy, including mindfulness, distress tolerance, emotion regulation, and interpersonal effectiveness.
citation: DBT Self-Help. (n.d.). *DBT Self-Help*. Retrieved from https://dbtselfhelp.com/

title: The ACT Companion App
description: An app based on Acceptance and Commitment Therapy (ACT) created by Dr. Russ Harris. Helps you practice skills and live a more meaningful life.
citation: Harris, R. (n.d.). *The ACT Companion App*. The Happiness Trap. Retrieved from https://thehappinesstrap.com/act-companion-app/

title: ADHD Overview for Adults
description: An overview of how ADHD affects adults, covering symptoms of inattention and hyperactivity, the biological basis of the disorder, and treatment options.
citation: Therapist Aid. (n.d.). *What is ADHD?*. Retrieved from https://www.therapistaid.com/therapy-worksheet/what-is-adhd

title: ADHD Overview for Teens
description: A guide for teenagers on the signs of ADHD, including inattention (e.g., mind wandering) and hyperactivity (e.g., fidgeting).
citation: Therapist Aid. (n.d.). *ADHD info for teens*. Retrieved from https://www.therapistaid.com/therapy-worksheet/adhd-info-for-teens

title: Class Assignments Tracker
description: A spreadsheet for tracking weekly readings and assignments for various courses, adaptable for personal use.
citation: Therapist Toolkit. (n.d.). *Class assignments tracker* [Google Sheet].

title: Breaking Down Large Goals
description: A worksheet that teaches how to break down large, overwhelming goals into smaller, manageable tasks. It provides tips like limiting tasks to one hour and scheduling them.
citation: Therapist Aid. (n.d.). *Goal breakdown*. Retrieved from https://www.therapistaid.com/therapy-worksheet/goal-breakdown

title: Children's ADHD Skill Packet
description: A resource packet for children with skills like 'Ocean Breathing' for calming down, creating daily routines, and a 4-step guide to problem-solving for challenges like losing homework.
citation: Therapist Aid. (n.d.). *ADHD kangaroo packet*. Retrieved from https://www.therapistaid.com/therapy-worksheet/adhd-kangaroo-packet

title: Tips for ADHD Management
description: A guide on managing ADHD symptoms through creating structure, setting aside time for relationships, staying organized with to-do lists, tailoring your environment, and maintaining a healthy lifestyle.
citation: Therapist Aid. (n.d.). *Managing ADHD*. Retrieved from https://www.therapistaid.com/therapy-worksheet/managing-adhd

title: Anxiety Coping Skills
description: A worksheet with techniques for managing anxiety, including deep breathing, progressive muscle relaxation, challenging irrational thoughts, and guided imagery.
citation: Therapist Aid. (n.d.). *Coping skills - anxiety*. Retrieved from https://www.therapistaid.com/therapy-worksheet/coping-skills-anxiety

title: Ways to Stop Ruminating
description: An article detailing 15 therapeutic tips to break the cycle of ruminating thoughts, including grounding, distraction, mindfulness, and thought challenging.
citation: Choosing Therapy. (n.d.). *How to stop ruminating*. Retrieved from https://www.choosingtherapy.com/how-to-stop-ruminating/

title: Autism & Sexual Development
description: A guide for parents and autistic teens on navigating sexual development, covering topics like consent, relationships, sexual health, and masturbation.
citation: Raising Children Network. (n.d.). *Sexuality: Teens with ASD*. Retrieved from https://raisingchildren.net.au/autism/development/sexual-development/sexuality-teens-with-asd

title: The Autistic Burnout Symptom Checklist
description: A self-assessment checklist for autistic adults to identify and track symptoms of burnout across physical, cognitive, executive functioning, social, emotional, and sensory domains.
citation: Nicholls, E. (2023). *The Autistic Burnout Symptom Checklist*. Retrieved from https://www.drelisenicholls.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/09/The-Autistic-Burnout-Symptom-Checklist-V2.pdf

title: Defining Autistic Burnout (Raymaker et al., 2020)
description: A research paper defining autistic burnout as a syndrome characterized by chronic exhaustion, loss of skills, and reduced tolerance to stimulus resulting from chronic life stress.
citation: Raymaker, D. M., Teo, A. R., Steckler, N. A., Lentz, B., Scharer, M., Delos Santos, K., ... & Nicolaidis, C. (2020). 'Having all of your internal resources exhausted beyond measure and being left with no clean-up crew': Defining autistic burnout. *Autism in Adulthood, 2*(2), 132-143.

title: Interpersonal Trauma and PTSD in Autistic Adults
description: A study on the high rates of interpersonal trauma (IPT) and PTSD in autistic adults, highlighting increased vulnerability for women and gender minorities.
citation: Rumball, F., Happé, F., & Grey, N. (2020). Experience of trauma and PTSD symptoms in autistic adults: risk and resilience factors. *Autism, 24*(8), 2131-2142.

title: Dissociation in Autism Spectrum Disorders
description: A book chapter exploring dissociation as a common but under-recognized symptom in autistic individuals, often linked to anxiety, trauma, and sensory overstimulation.
citation: Lanius, R. A., & Frewen, P. A. (2022). Dissociation in Autism Spectrum Disorders: An Under-Recognized Symptom and Syndrome. In *The Divided Self: The Healing Power of Integrated Mind-Body-Spirit*. W.W. Norton.

title: Dissociation of Brain Activation in Autism and Schizotypal Personality Disorder During Social Judgments
description: An fMRI study comparing brain activation during social judgments in adults with Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) and Schizotypal Personality Disorder (SPD).
citation: Ciaramidaro, A., Bölte, S., Goucha, T., Kolli, S., Poustka, F., & Walter, H. (2021). Dissociation of brain activation in adults with autism spectrum disorder and schizotypal personality disorder during a social judgment task. *Journal of Psychiatric Research, 137*, 308-317.

title: Co-occurring Autism and Trauma, PTSD, and Dissociation
description: An article for clinicians on identifying and treating co-occurring autism, trauma, and dissociation, discussing symptom overlap and treatment considerations.
citation: ISST-D News. (n.d.). *Co-occurring autism and trauma, posttraumatic stress, and dissociation*. Retrieved from https://news.isst-d.org/co-occurring-autism-and-trauma-posttraumatic-stress-and-dissociation/

title: The Autism-Dissociation Association
description: A presentation exploring the overlaps and interactions between autism and dissociation, reframing trauma as 'Chronic Unaddressed Toxic Stress' (CUTS).
citation: Autscape. (2023). *The Autism-Dissociation Association* [PDF]. Retrieved from https://www.autscape.org/2023/programme/handouts/autscape-2023-autism-dissociation-association.pdf

title: Autism: A Dissociated Self
description: A presentation exploring the relationship between autism, anxiety, and dissociation from a psychotherapeutic and neurobiological perspective.
citation: Doyle, R. (2018). *Autism: A dissociated self* [PDF]. British Association for Counselling and Psychotherapy. Retrieved from https://www.bacp.co.uk/media/4430/oct18_cpdhub_ramidoyle.pdf

title: Decision Making Strategies
description: An overview of various decision-making models, including a 7-step process, ethical frameworks (consequentialism, deontology), and the RAID model for categorizing decisions.
citation: Therapist Toolkit. (n.d.). *Decision making strategies* [Google Doc].

title: Focusing Options & Sleepiness Tracking
description: A list of strategies to improve focus by managing sleepiness and engaging in motor skills or stimulating activities, including a log for tracking patterns of tiredness.
citation: Therapist Toolkit. (n.d.). *Focusing options & sleepiness tracking* [Google Doc].

title: Emotional Regulation Cheat Sheet
description: A cheat sheet outlining six useful emotional regulation skills: Self-Awareness, Mindful Awareness, Cognitive Reappraisal, Adaptability, Self-Compassion, and Emotional Support.
citation: Scribd. (n.d.). *Emotion Regulation Workshop*. Retrieved from https://www.scribd.com/presentation/741900953/Emotion-Regulation-Workshop

title: Grounding Techniques
description: A list of grounding techniques to help manage anxiety and dissociation by reconnecting with the present moment through sensory experiences.
citation: Therapist Toolkit. (n.d.). *Grounding techniques* [Google Doc].

title: Wellness Check-In
description: A guide defining eight dimensions of wellness (Emotional, Social, Environmental, Physical, Intellectual, Spiritual, Professional, Financial) with examples for self-reflection.
citation: Therapist Toolkit. (n.d.). *Wellness check-in* [Google Doc].

title: Controlling Cognitive Distortions
description: A 4-step guide to help recognize, challenge, and gain control over negative thoughts and cognitive distortions that contribute to stress and depression.
citation: Therapist Toolkit. (n.d.). *Controlling cognitive distortions* [Google Doc].

title: Positive Psychology Prompt Cards
description: A set of printable cards with prompts designed to encourage positive reflection on daily events, personal strengths, and moments of gratitude.
citation: Therapist Aid. (n.d.). *Positive psychology prompt cards*. Retrieved from https://www.therapistaid.com/therapy-worksheet/positive-psychology-prompt-cards

title: What is Imposter Syndrome?
description: A worksheet defining imposter syndrome, its common traits, consequences, and risk factors, especially among high-achieving individuals.
citation: Therapist Aid. (n.d.). *Imposter syndrome*. Retrieved from https://www.therapistaid.com/therapy-worksheet/imposter-syndrome

title: My Strengths and Qualities
description: A worksheet with prompts to help individuals identify and reflect upon their personal strengths, qualities, accomplishments, and values.

title: Positive Traits List
description: A comprehensive list of positive character traits to help individuals identify their own strengths and positive qualities.
citation: Therapist Aid. (n.d.). *Positive traits*. Retrieved from https://www.therapistaid.com/therapy-worksheet/positive-traits

title: Self-Esteem Journal
description: A weekly journaling worksheet with daily prompts to encourage reflection on accomplishments, positive experiences, and moments of pride to build self-esteem.
citation: Therapist Aid. (n.d.). *Self-esteem journal*. Retrieved from https://www.therapistaid.com/therapy-worksheet/self-esteem-journal

title: Strengths Exploration
description: A multi-page worksheet designed to help individuals identify their core strengths and explore how to apply them in relationships, their profession, and for personal fulfillment.
citation: Therapist Aid. (n.d.). *Strengths exploration*. Retrieved from https://www.therapistaid.com/therapy-worksheet/strengths-exploration

title: Venn Diagram - ADHD & Autism
description: A Venn diagram illustrating the overlapping and distinct traits of ADHD and Autism.
citation: Neurodivergent Insights. (n.d.). *ADHD vs. Autism*. Retrieved from https://neurodivergentinsights.com/adhd-vs-autism/

description: A Venn diagram showing the interplay of symptoms between ADHD, Autism, and Anxiety.

title: Venn Diagram - ADHD, Autism & PTSD
description: A Venn diagram illustrating the complex symptom overlap between ADHD, Autism, and PTSD.

title: Venn Diagram - ADHD, Autism & OCD
description: A Venn diagram comparing the traits of ADHD, Autism, and OCD, highlighting areas of convergence.

description: A Venn diagram showing the shared and distinct symptoms of ADHD and Anxiety.

description: A Venn diagram illustrating the overlapping and distinct traits of ADHD and BPD.

description: A video by Healthy Gamer that explores the underlying reasons why boundaries can be difficult to maintain, especially in certain relationships.

title: Interactive Values Assessment
description: An interactive online tool from Therapist Aid to help individuals identify and clarify their core personal values.
citation: Therapist Aid. (n.d.). *Interactive values assessment*. Retrieved from https://www.therapistaid.com/interactive-therapy-tool/values-assessment

title: Feeling the Impact of Self-Criticism
description: A worksheet to help clients recognize their own critical voice and feel its emotional impact, building self-awareness and motivation for change.
citation: ACT with Compassion. (n.d.). *Feeling the impact of self-criticism*. Retrieved from https://www.actwithcompassion.com/feeling-the-impact-of-self-criticism

title: Shame Psychoeducation Handout
description: A handout explaining what shame is, its purpose, and how it affects thoughts, the body, and relationships. Designed for clients experiencing high shame.
citation: ACT with Compassion. (n.d.). *May compassion tool of the month*. Retrieved from https://www.actwithcompassion.com/may-compassion-tool-of-the-month/

title: WALKS the TALK: A Skill for Receiving Feedback
description: A worksheet outlining the WALKS the TALK practice to help individuals, especially those who are self-critical, respond to feedback more effectively.
citation: ACT with Compassion. (n.d.). *Helping people who are highly self-critical benefit from feedback*. Retrieved from https://www.actwithcompassion.com/helping-people-who-are-highly-self-critical-benefit-from-feedback

title: How to Use Theories in Clinical Practice
description: A guide for clinicians on the practical application of therapeutic theories, including case conceptualization, intervention selection, and fostering the therapeutic relationship.
citation: Therapist Toolkit. (n.d.). *How to use theories in clinical practice* [Google Doc].

title: Art Therapy Theory
description: An overview of Art Therapy, detailing its history, key principles, how it works, and its applications for various populations and mental health conditions.
citation: Therapist Toolkit. (n.d.). *Art therapy theory* [Google Doc].

title: Existential Therapy Overview
description: A handout from Therapist Aid explaining the core concepts of Existential Therapy, including the search for meaning, self-awareness, and facing existential anxieties.
citation: Therapist Aid. (n.d.). *Existential therapy* [PDF]. Retrieved from Therapist Aid.

title: Internal Family Systems (IFS) Overview
description: A comprehensive guide to the Internal Family Systems model, detailing the concepts of Self, Exiles, Managers, and Firefighters.
citation: Therapist Toolkit. (n.d.). *Internal Family Systems (IFS) overview* [Google Doc].

title: Introduction to Polyvagal Theory
description: An introductory guide to Polyvagal Theory, explaining the roles of the ventral vagal, sympathetic, and dorsal vagal systems in emotional and physiological states.
citation: Therapist Toolkit. (n.d.). *Introduction to Polyvagal Theory* [Google Doc].

title: The Four Stages of Competence
description: A handout explaining the four stages of learning a new skill: Unconscious Incompetence, Conscious Incompetence, Conscious Competence, and Unconscious Competence.
citation: Therapist Toolkit. (n.d.). *The four stages of competence* [Google Doc].

title: Relational Cultural Theory (RCT) Overview
description: An introduction to Relational Cultural Theory, which posits that human connection and relational growth are central to psychological well-being.
citation: Therapist Toolkit. (n.d.). *Relational Cultural Theory (RCT) overview* [Google Doc].

title: Solution-Focused Brief Therapy (SFBT) Guide
description: A presentation outlining the principles and techniques of Solution-Focused Brief Therapy, including the 'Miracle Question' and focusing on client strengths.
citation: Therapist Toolkit. (n.d.). *Solution-Focused Brief Therapy (SFBT) guide* [Google Slides].

title: Somatic Experiencing Overview
description: A guide to Somatic Experiencing, a body-focused therapy aimed at relieving the symptoms of trauma and stress by focusing on the client's perceived body sensations.
citation: Therapist Toolkit. (n.d.). *Somatic Experiencing overview* [Google Doc].

title: Structural Family Therapy Overview
description: An introduction to Structural Family Therapy, focusing on family structures, subsystems, and boundaries as a way to resolve problems.
citation: Therapist Toolkit. (n.d.). *Structural Family Therapy overview* [Google Doc].

title: Transpersonal Therapy Overview
description: A guide to Transpersonal Therapy, which integrates the spiritual, social, emotional, and physical aspects of the human experience.
citation: Therapist Toolkit. (n.d.). *Transpersonal Therapy overview* [Google Doc].

title: Set for Empowered Boundaries
description: A book by Nedra Glover Tawwab providing practical advice and techniques for setting healthy boundaries in various life domains.
citation: Tawwab, N. G. (2021). *Set boundaries, find peace: A guide to reclaiming yourself*. TarcherPerigee.

title: The Set Boundaries Workbook
description: A workbook by Nedra Glover Tawwab with exercises and prompts to help readers practice and implement boundary-setting skills.
citation: Tawwab, N. G. (2022). *The set boundaries workbook: Practical exercises for understanding your needs and communicating your limits*. TarcherPerigee.

title: Professional Troublemaker: The Fear-Fighter Manual
description: A book by Luvvie Ajayi Jones about overcoming fear to speak truth, set boundaries, and live authentically.
citation: Jones, L. A. (2021). *Professional troublemaker: The fear-fighter manual*. Penguin Life.

title: Why Setting Boundaries is an Act of Self-Care
description: An article on Oprah Daily explaining the importance of boundary setting as a fundamental aspect of self-care and mental well-being.

description: A directory of various book clubs and reading groups in the Seattle area, hosted by the Seattle Book Review.
citation: Seattle Book Review. (n.d.). *Book clubs*. Retrieved from https://www.seattlebookrev.com/book-clubs
